formattedAddress: 299 Pearl St, New York, NY 10038, USA
adrFormatAddress: 299 Pearl St, New York, NY 10038, USA

originalText.text: It was around 10:30pm when I pulled into the garage entrance, there was nobody to be found. Then I saw one young guy further down in the garage arguing with a couple (over what, I couldn't tell). And another guy stepped out from wherever he was and yelled incoherently after I drove in to look for a parking space. It was only then that I realized the whistle I heard before the "Yo!" was his attempt at communicating something, instead of using words. The whistle sounded like a notification going off in the office. They couldn't make up their mind about where they wanted me to put my car, the first guy said I was everything was good, but then the one who didn't feel like using his voice to do his job started using it to complain, saying "What's so hard about stopping!?" Depsite never telling me to pull up and stop anywhere. He was upset I didn't respond to anything he did, as if grunting and whistling is a form of spoken language used by all. Mind you all of the signs were indicating to drive forward further into the garage and it was the first time I even used one of these parking garages. It was actually my first time/day/hour in New York City, I guess what they say about people being rude for no reason here is based in truth. I always assumed it was an exaggeration, but found out the hard way - it's not. At least the people working the day shift were better.

originalText.text: Worst place to park. There is no order for customers to come in and go out. The price is exorbitant. And on top of this a convenience fee is charged.

text.text: Worst place to park. There is no order for customers to come in and go out. The price is exorbitant. And on top of this a convenience fee is charged.

originalText.text: The staff are ALL AMAZING, COURTEOUS & PROFESSIONAL!!! The supervisor is also very attentive to your concerns, needs & any other issues you may have. I park here everyday & it's worth the money & peace of mind that I get when I leave my car to go to work. The price is pretty good when you compare to the other garages I  the area but the staff makes a world of difference!!!

originalText.text: they failed to honor the coupon which is bad business practice. It is 3:50 am and my car was parked less than 6 hrs so I should have paid 15.00 but since the machine didn't work they said they could not verify the time and made me pay 52.00. The staff was very professional and understanding. This led me to believe that company policy is engineered to rob people. Be advised.

originalText.text: These guys are the absolute best. I’ve been parking here everyday for over a year now and will continue to do so for as long as I work downtown. I have never waited longer than 2 minutes for my car. The whole crew couldn’t be nicer.
